Let me know if you get one of these. We'll put all our resources at your disposal. BRUCE nods thoughtfully as ALFRED appears to see the Commissioner out.  A moment later, the butler reappears. BRUCE
Changed my mind, Alfred.  I'll be dropping in on the Fluegelheim after all.

It's a party to celebrate the opening of the new Egyptian exhibit, and the Fluegelheim is hopping.  BOARD MEMBERS, MUSEUM PATRONS, and SOCIALITES mill about in dinner jacke and evening gowns, making small talk.  AN OPEN SARCOPHAGU been set up as a wet bar. On a raised concrete platform in the center of the hall, rimmed by a decorative moat, sits an ancient Egyptian SHR The TEMPLE OF BASTET has been moved to Gotham and reconstructed in the Fluegelheim --sandstone walls, fount statuary and all. Guarding the entrance is a stately bronze statue of the goddess BASTET -- who has the body of a woman and the hea a pointy-eared CAT.  She holds an aegis and a sistrum; fo tiny KITTENS romp at her feet.  BRUCE, who's just arrived taking an intense interest in the cat-goddess... VICKI
What is it? BRUCE

I just had a weird sense of  deja vu . He glances over by the sarcophagus and sees PROVOST, the publisher, huddle with ELIOT TIPTREE III, transit magnate the remaining member of Gotham's "Five Families."  The tw them are engaged in some urgent conversation which he can quite make out... TIPTREE

Harrison -- we really ought to warn Bruce. We owe him that much. BRUCE detaches himself from VICKI and strolls toward them PROVOST and TIPTREE force smiles and wave, affecting an a nonchalance. PROVOST (cont.)
The man's a space cadet.  Let him look out for himself. (as BRUCE arrives; cheerfully) Why, Bruce!  What a delightful surprise. BRUCE

Good to see you two.  Looks like the Five Families are suddenly down to three. (looking around) In fact, if somebody dropped a bomb on this room right now -- TIPTREE chuckles nervously.  PROVOST is even  less amused. PROVOST
Is that your idea of a joke, Bruce? BRUCE
Not at all.  Commissioner Gordon seems to think we should all be hiring bodyguards.
Oh, that's absurd.                I already have. The two of them glower at each other.  It's like an outta from  The Newlywed Game .  BRUCE shrugs it off and makes a vacuous face: BRUCE

Thing is, I can't imagine why Batman would be after us.  Can you? PROVOST and TIPTREE are about to go into another round of hemming-and-hawing when a NEW FACE joins the party.  It's SELINA KYLE -- stunning as ever in an extravagantly revea dress slit up to the armpits.  She's holding two glasses CHAMPAGNE... SELINA
You two look like you need a drink.  -- And is this who I think it is? She flashes BRUCE her most winning, seductive, heavy-arti SMILE.  He BLINKS, temporarily speechless. PROVOST
Selina Kyle -- Bruce Wayne. SELINA
Our absentee board member!  I've been wanting to meet you  forever . TIPTREE
Selina's the new Curator of Antiquities. She brought the Temple over block by block -- SELINA

You two won't be terribly upset if I borrow Bruce for a moment, will you? Before he can protest, she's linked an arm around his and dragged him off.  A nearby FAT MAN spots SELINA, wiggles eyebrows and WAVES BRIGHTLY.  His tongue is practically hanging out -- he's just dying to write her a check.  SEL SIGHS WEARILY to BRUCE: SELINA (cont.)
Major contributor.  -- I always seem to wind up in charge of fund-raising... BRUCE
I can't imagine why. SELINA
Tax year's almost over, you know.  I hope we can count on your usual generous donation. (indicating PROVOST and TIPTREE) Someone's got to set an example for those two tightwads. BRUCE
They're proccupied.  This string of murders -- SELINA
I asked them if they'd consider including us in their wills. (chuckling to herself) They didn't seem a  bit amused...
She's making small talk with a bunch of STUFFED SHIRTS an their overdressed WIVES.  She glances across the room at statue of Bastet, sees SELINA draped all over BRUCE.  A f crosses her face...
She's still clinging to his arm as they stare up at the statue. SELINA
-- and this is my good friend Bastet, the Egyptian Cat Goddess. BRUCE
I think we've already met.  -- This is quite an expedition you've put together. SELINA
I'm glad you think so.  I have to say, Bruce -- you're not at  all what I expected. BRUCE
Sorry to disappoint you. SELINA
Oh, it's not that.  Not at  all .  It's just that I'd always heard you were... BRUCE
What? SELINA
(coyly) Oh...sort of a... BRUCE

The PENGUIN grins with delight as the van speeds off unmolested. PENGUIN
Look at that, boys -- they  do flock together!!

AMBULANCES are pouring into the square as the BAT ATTACK continues.  COPS are firing their guns blindly into the s as they try to evacuate the citizenry.  PARAMEDICS drop t stretcher they're carrying when BATS swoop down at their heads...

BATMAN is still pursuing the CATWOMAN, who's perched one over, in a squat, wiggling a finger for him to follow.  T roofs are icy and treacherous, but he matches her step fo step, leap for leap, as she vaults from one building to t next, leading him on.  Finally she reaches the edge of a building on the corner of the block; there's no place to but down.  She squats on the ledge and smiles, beckoning him -- CATWOMAN

Ooh.  Where have you  been all my life? He edges closer.  Suddenly, she does a BACKFLIP -- DIRECT OFF THE EDGE OF THE ROOF. BATMAN hears GLASS SHATTERING.  He hesitates a second -- closer to the edge of the roof -- PEERS OVER THE ICY CORN
Staring down, he sees a narrow LEDGE running around the f of the building some ten or twelve feet below.  The windo a corner apartment has been smashed; the curtains are fla in the chill wind.

She's obviously making her getaway through the apartment. BATMAN climbs up on the slippery cornice and prepares to to the ledge below -- cautiously, because it's a long way down.  A sudden CRACK -- The CATWOMAN  hasn't entered the apartment.  Instead, she's followed the ledge around the corner of the building, sil doubling back onto the roof behind BATMAN.  He TURNS just her WHIP wraps itself around his left leg.  She gives it sharp tug -- his feet SKID on the ice -- and HE TOPPLES O THE EDGE OF THE ROOF.

He plunges downward for the briefest of seconds -- then J UP SHORT, SLAMMING INTO THE WALL OF THE BUILDING.  The WH has coiled itself around his leg, and for now it's holdin tight.  He's dangling upside down, bat-like; he bounces a from the wall; he SPINS in midair as one loop of the whip UNRAVELS, dropping him another foot or so. He manages to brace his left foot against the wall.  It's massive strain, but he's momentarily safe if he can keep moving.  The alternative is a twelve-story drop, straight to the pavement...

She's wrapped the handle-end of the whip around an expose pipe on the roof, anchoring BATMAN in place.  With a ches cat grin, she removes the RAVEN from her knapsack and hol on the edge of the cornice.
BATMAN hanging immobile.  Craning his neck, he can just s the RAVEN STATUETTE on the ledge above him -- bouncing slight and apparently  talking to him... CATWOMAN (O.S.)
Nevermore.  Nevermore! Now the CATWOMAN appears beside it -- elbows on the corni chin propped up on her folded hands, like a chatty girl a fern bar. CATWOMAN

Cute, huh!  I think it'll look nice over the fireplace.  Maybe you can drop by and see it sometime. (demurely) I hope you won't think I'm too... aggressive or anything, but I find you very attractive. She toys aimlessly with the whipcord, batting at it like with a piece of yarn.  BATMAN grimaces.  She speaks in a soothing, seductive tone -- almost a purr.  Behind the bo mask she bats her eyelashes. CATWOMAN (cont.)
It's just so hard to meet interesting men these days.  Don't you think so? (sighing) I have trouble with relationships.  Men find me intimidating...kind of  predatory

you know?  Really I'm not.  Really I'm just playful... BATMAN huffs and puffs, trying to bend at the waist so he grab hold of the whip.  She frowns and YANKS on it.  His flies free of the wall, and another loop of the whip unco before he can stabilize himself. CATWOMAN (cont.)
Don't laugh!  I'm trying to open up to you! Angrily, she holds a STEEL CLAW to the whip -- ready to c him loose.
He's palmed the GRAPPLING-HOOK LAUNCHER from his belt. Holding it close to his body, out of view, he works it ar into firing position.  He'll shoot it right through her i has to... CATWOMAN (cont.)
I always seem to fall for the wrong guys. You know...most men are  rats .
She withdraws her hand from the whip, reverts to her philosphical mode. CATWOMAN

Mice , really.  It's disgusting -- they beg you to walk all over them and then they whine when you do it.  Once you've had your fun there's not much you can do but kill them. (beat) But you seem different.  I mean, you obviously understand about dressing up... that saves a lot of explaining.  I think people should indulge their fantasies, don't you? BATMAN is sweating profusely.  He can't hold his position longer.  And the CATWOMAN is dragging this insane flirtat out endlessly... CATWOMAN

So I think I'll let you live.  Cute boys like you are hard to find... (standing up) 'Bye, angel.  I'll be thinking about you. And just like that, she VANISHES -- moving silently off w her raven, leaving BATMAN to dangle.  He hangs there a mo tries to twist himself around without moving his foot.  H braces one hand against the wall; with the other, he lift grappling gun and FIRES. The HOOK SNAGS somewhere on the roof.  BATMAN yanks the l taut and is laboriously trying to pull himself erect when -- the CATWOMAN reappears over the edge of the cornice! CATWOMAN

Gee...I'm  so fickle . A QUICK SWIPE of her STEEL TALONS, and the whipcord is ne SEVERED.  BATMAN'S FOOT slips out from under him -- but h still got hold of the GRAPPLING GUN.  He DROPS eight or t feet...
watching with amusement as BATMAN's weight causes the hoo DISLODGE.  It skitters across the gravel surface of the r and CATCHES, at the last instant, on the edge of the
-- which promptly CRUMBLES and GIVES WAY.  Fascinated, th CATWOMAN leans over the edge of the roof and peers down..

He flails wildly, tangled in his cape, as the ground rush toward him.  He gets a last-ditch inspiration -- finds th CYLINDER on his belt and hits the switch.  The rods in hi cape begin to INFLATE... Six stories up, his BATWINGS spring erect, slowing his pl Five stories up, an UPDRAFT hits him and he suddenly INVE Four stories up, he rights himself.  Three stories up, he into a downward spiral, out of control, gliding in great arcs over the street... ...and a moment later there are no stories left.  With an crunch, he smacks into the slush-covered pavement and BOU Face down, he skids some twenty feet to a halt -- right i middle of a BUSY INTERSECTION.

A DELIVERY TRUCK hits the brakes and screeches to a stop, feet away from BATMAN'S HEAD.  He doesn't move.  PEDESTRI are already gawking and pointing as the DRIVER climbs out peers down at the inert caped figure lying face-down in t street: DRIVER
What the hell is  this
CARS are backed up, due to the panic in Gotham Square a f blocks over.  HORNS are honking.  A TRAFFIC COP marches over -- TRAFFIC COP

Awright, what's the problem here? (spotting BATMAN) Jesus. He tries to clear the crowd away.  A full-fledged GRIDLOC forming around the prostrate BATMAN.  The COP blows his whistle, tries to maintain order as two unifonned PATROLM rush up to join him. They manage to roll the unconscious BATMAN over on his ba The assembled COPS stare down at the mask, the scuffed bo armor.  Still waxy, they finger the GUNS in their holster PATROLMAN

Good God.  Cowan -- get to the car -- radio the commissioner!! By now there must be two hundred people in the intersecti all surging forward to get a look.  More COPS are arrivin beat them back. TRAFFIC COP
Is he dead?  What do we  do
PATROLMAN
The mask.  Get the mask off. They hunker down over BATMAN.  One of them tugs at his ma but the helmet-like cowl doesn't want to give way.  He fe around -- TRAFFIC COP

Some kinda seam here on the neck... The PATROLMAN nods okay, and the COP tugs at a Velcro-lik fastening under BATMAN's chin.  The instant it comes open -- a BURST of FINE GREEN MIST spews forth from concealed in the gold-and-black BAT-EMBLEM, and the COPS reel backw shrieking, gasping for breath and clewing at their eyes. Booby-trap -- they've just been  Maced . One of the ONLOOKING COPS steps back in horror and confus On impulse, he draws his gun and FIRES TWICE at BATMAN. body JERKS and the bullets RICOCHET OFF -- TRAFFIC COP
DON'T SHOOT, you idiot.  The  crowd

Before he can finish, a BLACK BOOT kicks the gun out of t ONLOOKING COP's hand.  BATMAN is back among the living. SIRENS BLARE as he spins and rolls into a crouch -- lashi out with elbows and knees -- driving the cops back -- Fuck the crowd.  TWO MORE COPS pull their guns and open f in absolute panic.  BATMAN slams backward into the delive truck and crumples to the ground.  As he falls, he grabs couple of SMOKE CAPSULES from his belt and flings them to pavement. Seconds later, a THICK CLOUD OF BLACK SMOKE is spreading through the intersection.  BATMAN emerges into the midst the crowd -- weaving in and out among the stalled vehicle

A MOUNTED COP rides up to the outer fringe of the traffic drawn by all the confusion.  He rears the horse back, tur in a circle; blows his piercing whistle as he tries to re the incoming cars... Suddenly a WIRE wraps itself around his chest and arms. looks down.  He sees a BATARANG in the instant before a s JERK pulls him cleanly off his mount. BATMAN climbs up on the hood of the nearest car -- vaults to the next -- and the next -- then hops into the saddle the MOUNTED COP's waiting HORSE.  He digs in his heels, maneuvering through traffic...

LT. EDDIE BULLOCK and another plainclothesman are a few b off trying to get through the jam.  Their siren is on, bu cars blocking their path have no room to pull over.  BULL grabs the radio mike: BULLOCK

Hell of a mess up here, Commissioner. We'll have to go in on foot... As they wait for a response, they see a HORSE charging pa the opposite direction.  On the back of the horse...is BA Gaping, BULLOCK nudges his partner -- who throws the car immediately into REVERSE.  As they watch, BATMAN kicks th horse's flanks and turns right -- toward Gotham Park.
Two RED BERETS, members of the Order of the Bat, are on n patrol, strolling down a rambling path near the entrance the park. RED BERET I

This is wack, man.  Nothing ever happens around here anymore. The other RED BERET lets out a WHOOP OF FEAR and yanks hi partner out of the way.  They tumble into a snowdrift as BATMAN'S HORSE vaults over the stone wall of the park and gallops past, nearly trampling them in the process.  By n SQUAD CARS are roaring into the park...

SIRENS BLARE and RED LIGHTS FLASH in the distance as the CARS spread out along the winding roads that run through park.  BATMAN reins the horse in suddenly as a black-and- whips past on an access road just ahead of him, no more t twenty yards away. He turns the horse in a circle.  MORE RED LIGHTS appear i distance; another contingent of SQUAD CARS has just enter from the opposite side of the park.  It's going to be tou getting out of here... Then: his eyes fall on the statue of his great-grandfathe

two Waynes on horseback, not twenty feet apart.  He thinks back to his earlier conversation with V and gets an inspiration. He rides past General Wayne to the STONE BRIDGE which spa the little frozen creek.  There he finds the DRAINAGE TUN VICKI described, obscured by the wire-mesh grate.  This m be where the boy vigilante holes up... He dismounts, ties his CAPE to the pommel of the horse's saddle and sends it off with a slap.  He pries the grate and crawls inside.

A dank, but cozy, hideout; WARM STEAM hisses from a grate the floor. RUMBLING SOUNDS fill the little chamber as a SUBWAY TRAIN passes directly underneath.  A little farther back there' ACCESS SHAFT, with a Jacob's ladder, leading to the train tracks below. Poking around, he finds a couple of cardboard BOXES -- th vigilante's stash.  The first contains tins of food, plus various odds and ends.  The second's more in line with wh needs -- it's full of OLD CLOTHING. A TRAIN rumbles past underneath.  BRUCE removes his COWL sets about putting together a civilian disguise that'll g him out of the park.  A wool hat and a long, moth-eaten topcoat: perfect.  As he's pulling them out of the box, h spies something extremely odd -- It's a COSTUME -- a spangled red-and-green GYMNASTS OUTFI with a little yellow CAPE -- neatly folded and in pristin condition.  He removes it carefully from the box and hold up in front of him.  Stitched on the vest is a single ini "R," in a black circle.  He stares at the whole mystifyin ensemble in complete befuddlement... The roar of the train subsides, and he hears a SCUFFLING

Someone's in the tunnel with him .  He lowers the costume abruptly -- -- revealing DICK, the boy vigilante, who's crouched in f of him not three feet away.  The kid's just crawled up th the ACCESS SHAFT, and he's not at all happy to see an int messing with his stuff: DICK
It's MINE! He lunges furiously at BRUCE.  The two of them tumble bac into the grate at the tunnel entrance, KNOCKING IT LOOSE

A POLICE CAR streaks past on the bridge overhead mere sec before BRUCE and DICK roll out into the snow, still grapp BRUCE flings the kid into the bridge abutment.  DICK land hard; when he looks up, his EYES WIDEN, and a weird crook smile comes to his face... Out here in the moonlight he can  see his opponent.  The body armor -- the gold-and-black emblem on the breastplate -- above it all, the face of BRUCE WAYNE, exposed to view... As a siren howls nearby, BRUCE flattens himself against t bridge.  Like it or not, his fate rests entirely in a str little boy's hands. The kid sizes up the situation immediately.  He nods his up and down.  Then he takes off his  own ratty coat and throws it to BRUCE. BRUCE is in no position to look a gift horse in the mouth pulls on the coat, gives DICK a nod of acknowledgement, a starts to move off. DICK

BRUCE turns, uncertainly.  DICK throws him his woolen SKI The KID GIGGLES -- oddly, uncontrollably.  Then he sprint into the woods, dancing, leaping.  As he disappears from he lets out a shrill, piercing, almost FERAL SHRIEK -- -- which is obviously intended to divert the cops.  BRUCE makes haste in the opposite direction.
BRUCE'S HORSE gallops through the trees, the black bat-ca still attached to its saddle and BILLOWING behind it.

TWO COPS scanning the park.  The CAPED HORSE charges past front of them and is momentarily silhouetted in the headlights.  From a distance, it looks like BATMAN is sti the saddle. The COP at the wheel makes a sudden turn.  A moment later SLAMS ON THE BRAKES. A MAN has just stepped out onto the road, directly in the squad car's path -- a hunched figure in an old coat and w ski cap, obviously one of the homeless.  A COP leans on t horn and shouts out the window: COP
Dumb son of a bitch!! The MAN -- BRUCE -- steps back out of the squad car's pat The COPS take off -- in hot pursuit of a riderless horse.
A DOCTOR'S BAG rests on the kitchen table.  ALFRED, in ro and slippers, rummages inside it and comes up with an ACE BANDAGE. ALFRED

Commissioner Gordon called.  He wants to install a full contingent of police guards here at the manor -- in round-the-clock shifts -- to protect you from Batman. BRUCE is sitting erect in a straightbacked chair.  His sh is open and he's holding his arms aloft while ALFRED wrap full roll of adhesive tape around his battered RIBS. BRUCE
Great.  What'd you tell him? ALFRED

I told him that since you  were Batman, you'd require no protection  from Batman. BRUCE makes a face: how droll.  ALFRED tears off the tape a brisk YANK -- and BRUCE lets out an involuntary YELP OF PAIN. BRUCE
Jesus , Alfred -- !! ALFRED
In future, sir...I strongly advise against trying to fly off twenty-story buildings. BRUCE
It's just a few bruises. ALFRED
One bruise, sir.  Which covers your entire body. BRUCE gets up -- stiffly -- and buttons his shirt in ging fashion while ALFRED packs his first-aid gear in the doct bag. BRUCE
I'm getting too old for this line of work. (beat) Cops placed me at the scene of the crime -- that weird kid of Vicki's saw my face -- ALFRED
I shouldn't worry overmuch.  I doubt the two of you move in the same circles. BRUCE
-- and I got the living shit knocked out of me by a  woman . ALFRED
Sir -- such outmoded sexist attitudes are quite unbecoming.

In a lavishly-appointed guest room on Gotham's Upper East (or equivalent thereof), we find a pair of PLAINCLOTHES C settled in for a stakeout: rumpled topcoats thrown across antique chairs, french-fry bags and GREASY BURGER WRAPPIN littering the carpet.  HIGH-POWERED RIFLES propped agains wall. They peer through venetian blinds at an ELEGANT OLD BROWN across the street...
A UNIFORMED COP, also carrying a walkie-talkie, is keepin watch on the roof of the brownstone.  He signals "all cle to his counterpart watching from the house opposite.

TWO MORE PLAINCLOTHESMEN are parked at the end of the blo munching on donuts and watching the same brownstone.  The spot a POSTMAN lugging his sack up the tree-lined street his way to the brownstone.  One of the PLAINCLOTHESMEN pi up his RADIO MIKE: PLAINCLOTHESMAN
Mailman's coming.

The POSTMAN marches up the front steps of the brownstone, sorting through letters and packages.  He hasn't even run bell when the door is opened by ANOTHER COP -- who snatch the mail delivery from his hands and SLAMS THE DOOR IN HI FACE.

MORE COPS, at least half a dozen, are milling about insid unshaven, ties loosened, shirtsleeves rolled up.  They're for the long haul. The first COP gives a handful of letters to a couple of COLLEAGUES -- then hands over a PARCEL, wrapped in brown paper, to a pair of BOMB-DISPOSAL EXPERTS.  They carry it gingerly into the kitchen.  Into the midst of all this bustling activity strides COMMISSIONER GORDON: GORDON
Anything suspicious! In the parlor, where all the shades are drawn, TWO COPS a examining each letter in turn, holding them up to a light bulb, CREASING THEM carefully before slitting them open. COP
Nothing yet.  Christmas cards and bills. He anxiously watches their progress.  A VOICE calls from kitchen. BOMB-DISPOSAL EXPERT (V.O.)
Commissioner -- ?
GORDON enters.  The bomb-disposal boys have their equipme scattered all over the kitchen table.  They've slit the b paper wrapping of the PACKAGE, exposing a ROUND DECORATIV TIN. BOMB-DISPOSAL EXPERT
It's a fruitcake. He lifts the lid for GORDON to have a look. GORDON
...Have it analyzed.

A bleary-eyed ELLIOTT TIPTREE marches down the stairs car a pair of OVERSIZED SUITCASES.  His WIFE and TWO KIDS are behind him -- all bundled up, preparing to embark on an extended vacation. POLICEMAN
Mrs. Tiptree?  The car's here. TIPTREE, fighting back tears, embraces his wife for a lon wordless moment.  Their LITTLE GIRL, aged six, tugs at Mo sleeve. LITTLE GIRL
I don't wanna go to Grandma's.  I wanna stay here with Daddy. MRS. TIPTREE
She's got a nice tree just like ours, honey.  Daddy'll be up as soon as he can. LITTLE GIRL
She's old.  She doesn't even have cable. LITTLE BOY
What about our presents? He gestures toward the GIFTS piled high around the tree i parlor. TIPTREE
Don't worry.  I'll bring 'em up with me. We'll open 'em when I get there. TIPTREE forces a smile for the kids.  He CLUTCHES his wif hand. GORDON
Sorry, folks, but we'd better move along. MRS. TIPTREE
Kids?  Tell your Daddy goodbye... Tearful hugs all around; then a cadre of UNIFORMED COPS e MRS. TIPTREE and the KIDS to the door.  TIPTREE pulls GOR aside. TIPTREE
They'll be safe, won't they? GORDON
As safe as we can make 'em. (beat; sternly) It would help if you could give us some small hint what this is all about. TIPTREE
I told you.  I... TIPTREE shrugs helplessly and stares at his shoes.  GORDO convinced he's holding something back. GORDON
You have no idea what was in that box that Provost had delivered from the bank. TIPTREE shakes his head wearily.  GORDON glowers as he tu to go. GORDON (cont.)

All right, Mr. Tiptree.  Merry Christmas. GORDON exits.  TIPTREE wanders listlessly into the living room, pulls back the drapes, and WATCHES as his wife and ride off in a convoy of POLICE CARS.  One of the COPS tri pull him away from the window, but he refuses to move... ...until a PHONE RINGS.  Everyone jumps at once.  A TECHN hits a switch on a loudspeaker-and-tape-recorder assembly then gestures for TIPTREE to pick up the receiver... TIPTREE
Hello...? VOICE ON LOUDSPEAKER
Mr. Tiptree?  Andy here.  Listen -- we've got a chance to grab a good-sized block of Atlantic Teledyne at twenty-six and an eighth -- The COPS heave sighs and turn off their tracing equipment TIPTREE

Not today, Andy.  Let's talk after New Year's. TIPTREE hangs up and starts to BAWL right there in the mi of the room.  The COPS turn away in sympathetic embarrass as he goes to a corner wet bar and pours himself a good s jolt.

Wallowing in despair, TIPTREE sits at an antique secretar composing a LETTER.  He takes a long pull on a glass of Scotch, signs his name, and inserts the letter into an envelope.  He opens the desk drawer -- takes a long look .38 automatic stashed inside -- then finds a stamp and af it to the envelope.  He addresses it to BRUCE WAYNE. A moment later he hears a noise at the window: TINK TINK He peers through the blinds and sees a CARRIER PIGEON on ledge outside -- pecking at the glass, asking to come in. He raises the window and the PIGEON hops fearlessly insid onto the sill.  The bird, well-trained, struggles only slightly as he unties a tiny CAPSULE from its leg and rem a FOLDED NOTE.  Scrawled across it is a handwritten messa

head_text.subj: IF POLICE SEE THIS YOUR FAMILY IS DEAD

text: He opens the note and begins to read as the PIGEON takes
BRUCE is at his desk examining the morning editions.  A B HEAD-LINE shrieks:
Bat Attack Panics Gotham Square J. Harrison Provost, 41, Leaves Distinguished Legacy He hears a VISITOR arriving in the entry hall.  He gets u
BRUCE ambles out and sees SELINA, who's just arrived, doi her patetented thing on ALFRED. SELINA

English accents are  so stimulating . (beat) You have the most beautiful silver hair! ALFRED stammers as she reaches up to STROKE HIS HAIR.  He about to break into a sweat.  He's eminently relieved whe turns and sees -- SELINA (cont.)
Bruce! BRUCE
Selina.  What are  you doing here? ALFRED affects a look of grandmotherly outrage as SELINA slinks over and takes BRUCE by the arm.  She's on him lik barnacle. SELINA
I wanted to see your things, remember? And I got tired of waiting for you to call me back. (gesturing toward ALFRED) He's adorable.  How long have you had him?
BRUCE leads SELINA down a hallway to the armory.  He glan back over his shoulder and sees ALFRED peering snoopily a the corner. BRUCE
You heard about Harry Provost. SELINA
It's incredibly awful.  It got me a little worried. (sidling up closer) I hate to think of something happening to you . BRUCE
Same here. SELINA
It's odd, though.  Danger, the thought of suddenly dying -- in a weird way it gets you sort of...aroused.  Don't you think? BRUCE cocks an eyebrow at her.   Everything gets her sort of aroused.
SELINA BEAMS at the fantastic collection of armored gear exotic weapons.  She's like a kid in a toy shop. SELINA
Bruce, this is  incredible . (indicating a suit of armor) Malaysian -- ? BRUCE
Not bad.  Sarawak warrior caste. SELINA
It's like -- everything in here is another little piece of your mind.  I was right about you. (turning to face him) Promise, okay?  Promise you'll show me every inch of this place.
ALFRED is at a PRINTER, scanning page after page of compu printout.  He delivers his findings to BRUCE, who's seate a nearby terminal, scanning data and tapping away at the keyboard. ALFRED
The police have no files whatsoever on Selina Kyle. BRUCE
(abstractedly) London...Cairo...Belgium... ALFRED
What exactly are you -- BRUCE
Her credit card records. (looking up) Every major art theft in the last five years -- she's been on the scene or close to it. ALFRED
You mean she's some sort of -- collector? A...cat burglar, or -- BRUCE
Could be.  Museum curator, authenticator -- she's got the perfect cover for it. (beat) What would she want with that stupid raven? ALFRED
Raven, sir? BRUCE

That's what the Catwoman took from Provost.  A little raven statuette, about so big... (shaking his head) But it couldn't have been that valuable. He continues to scan the screen.  ALFRED is suddenly lost thought. ALFRED
How very odd. (long pause) I'm sure it's nothing, but -- BRUCE
What, Alfred? ALFRED

Your father had a raven, sir.  A small statue of the very sort you describe.  It used to sit on his desk. This piques BRUCE's interest.  He swivels around in his chair and stares directly up at ALFRED. BRUCE
What happened to it? ALFRED
After your father's...demise, Mr. Tiptree came to the house and asked if he could have it.  As a keepsake.  I saw no harm... (shrugging) That was thirty years ago. BRUCE
Wait a minute.  Mr. Tiptree? ALFRED
George Tiptree.  Your friend Elliott's father.
TIPTREE has an oversized suitcase open on the bed.  It's -- except for the BALLED-UP WADS of NEWSPAPER which he's stuffing inside it.  His head turns suddenly at the sound the doorbell...

TIPTREE emerges from his bedroom and peers over a bannist into the ENTRYWAY below.  Standing there is an unexpected visitor -- BRUCE WAYNE -- holding his arms aloft while a battery of COPS pat him down. BRUCE
What are you looking for -- Batarangs? TIPTREE
Bruce!  Come on up. (to the COPS) I want to talk to Mr. Wayne alone. The COPS look on suspiciously as BRUCE ascends the stairs
TIPTREE lets BRUCE inside and shuts the door behind him. BRUCE hands him a GIFT BOX. BRUCE

I brought you a Christmas present.  Sorry about the wrapping -- the police made me open it. TIPTREE opens the box and pulls out a diamond-studded TIE CLASP.  He looks up at BRUCE with an odd mixture of bewilderment and gratitude.  BRUCE nods for him to try it and he obliges... TIPTREE
...I'm afraid I don't have anything for you. BRUCE
I think you may have something that belonged to my father. TIPTREE
-- You know? He stares at BRUCE, astonished.  His head sinks into his hands. TIPTREE (cont.)
It'll all be over tomorrow.  One way or another, it'll all be over. (looking up; despondent) I've decided, Bruce.  I'm gonna give him the last two ravens.  He's already got the others. BRUCE
What are you talking about?   Who
TIPTREE
Batman.  I don't know how he found out, but -- TIPTREE reaches for the bottle on his desk to pour himsel drink, but BRUCE angrily knocks the glass out of his hand BRUCE
It's time you told me what's going on here . TIPTREE
Didn't you ever wonder where it came from, Bruce?  All the privilege, all the power ...all the  money
(beat) The ravens are a...a kind of  map , Bruce. The key to an incredibly vast fortune. BRUCE
Whose fortune? TIPTREE
Gotham City's.

The cobblestone streets of 19th-Century Gotham.  A massiv EXPLOSION blows open one wall of a municipal building, an total CHAOS erupts: fires starting, BYSTANDERS screaming, POLICE rushing to the scene... TIPTREE

In 1880 the Gotham City Treasury was looted.  It was a fantastic operation -- perfect military precision.  The robbers made off with milllons in gold and silver bullion... A HORSE-DRAWN CART weighted down with gold bricks careens around a corner.  Atop it are two men in MASKS, firing a GATLING GUN into the crowd.  POLICE and ONLOOKERS tumble the pavement, shot dead, as ANOTHER CART emerges from the wreckage of the treasury and takes off in the opposite direction.
CITY OFFICIALS in a boardroom trading papers back and for arguing furiously with five calm, distinguished-looking G -- one of whom is the bushy-bearded Civil War hero GEN. O WAYNE. TIPTREE (V.O.)
The city was going under.  Bankrupt... until  five rich men stepped in to bail it out.  In exchange they took the land rights, the mineral rights, the service contracts --
BRUCE
The Five Families. TIPTREE

Our ancestors.  They  bought Gotham City -- carved it up and ran it into the ground. In five years they were rich beyond imagining. (pause) We've just been following in their footsteps.  And in all this time no one's ever suspected -- BRUCE
-- that they were the ones behind the robbery?
The FIVE PATRIARCHS in front of a roaring fireplace at Wa Manor, raising a celebratory toast.  CAMERA PANS OVER to nearby table; on it rest FIVE RAVEN STATUETTES. TIPTREE (O.S.)

They had five ravens made.  Five ravens which -- combined -- would reveal the location of the treasure they'd stolen. (beat) But they never touched it.  They never needed to.  It's still there to this day.
TIPTREE

watching in the light from the train as the two costumed figures grapple in the distance.  He races back toward th scene of the melee...

want? VICKI tries to lay a soothing arm on his shoulder.  He ba away, pushes her aside and turns toward the door in agitation -- DICK

ARCTIC BIRDS chirping all around in the penguin-pool room SNOW OWL struts across the PENGUIN's desk as SELINA makes phone call -- with the PENGUIN, FRICK, and FRACK hovering her. SELINA
